title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Samos J (2024). sigugr: Geographic Data Processing Integration. R package version 0.1.0, https://josesamos.github.io/sigugr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sigugr: Geographic Data Processing and Integration},   author = {Jose Samos},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://josesamos.github.io/sigugr/}, }

title: Geographic Data Processing and Integration
text: goal sigugr …

title: Geographic Data Processing and Integration
text: can install development version sigugr GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("josesamos/sigugr")

title: Geographic Data Processing and Integration
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(sigugr) ## basic example code

what: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
text: Aggregates raster files (`.tif` `.jp2`) specified folder given factor saves resulting files output folder.

title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
code: aggregate_rasters(dir, out_dir, factor = 2)

title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
text: dir string specifying input folder containing raster files. out_dir string specifying output folder aggregated rasters saved. factor integer specifying aggregation factor (default 2).

title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
text: character vector paths processed raster files.

title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
text: output folder exist, creates .

title: Aggregate Rasters in a Folder — aggregate_rasters
code: temp_dir <- tempdir() input_dir <- system.file("extdata", "mdt", package = "sigugr")  result_files <- aggregate_rasters(input_dir, temp_dir, factor = 4)

what: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
title: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
text: function clips vector layer (e.g., points, lines, polygons) using polygon layer. handles CRS (Coordinate Reference System) transformations automatically necessary, ensuring output CRS input polygon.

title: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
code: clip_layer(vector, polygon)

title: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
text: vector `sf` object representing vector layer clipped. polygon `sf` object representing polygon layer used clipping.

title: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
text: `sf` object containing features input `vector` intersect `polygon`. output CRS `polygon`, retain attributes input `vector`.

title: Clip a Vector Layer with a Polygon — clip_layer
code: gpkg_path <- system.file("extdata", "clc.gpkg", package = "clc")  clc <- sf::st_read(gpkg_path, layer = "clc", quiet = TRUE) lanjaron <- sf::st_read(gpkg_path, layer = "lanjaron", quiet = TRUE)  clc_clipped <- clip_layer(clc, lanjaron)

what: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
text: function clips `MULTIPOLYGON` vector layer using polygon layer, handling specific issues might arise geometries encoded incorrectly containing unknown WKB types. serves fallback `clip_layer()` function fails due errors like `ParseException: Unknown WKB type 12`, associated *MULTIPOLYGON* types.

title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
code: clip_multipoligon(vector, polygon)

title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
text: vector `sf` multipolygon vector layer clipped. polygon `sf` polygon layer used clipping geometry.

title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
text: `sf` vector layer clipped geometries.

title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
text: function ensures input layer correctly encoded `MULTIPOLYGON` uses GDAL utilities re-encoding necessary. output projected CRS clipping polygon. solution inspired discussion handling WKB type errors R: <https://gis.stackexchange.com/questions/389814/r-st-centroid-geos-error-unknown-wkb-type-12>.

title: Safe Clip a Multipolygon Vector Layer — clip_multipoligon
code: gpkg_path <- system.file("extdata", "clc.gpkg", package = "clc")  clc <- sf::st_read(gpkg_path, layer = "clc", quiet = TRUE) lanjaron <- sf::st_read(gpkg_path, layer = "lanjaron", quiet = TRUE)  clc_clipped <- clip_multipoligon(clc, lanjaron)

what: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
title: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
text: function clips raster using polygon, preserving coordinate reference system (CRS) raster.

title: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
code: clip_raster(raster, polygon)

title: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
text: raster `terra` raster clipped. polygon `sf` polygon layer used clipping.

title: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
text: `terra` raster clipped extent polygon.

title: Clip a raster based on a polygon — clip_raster
code: source_gpkg <- system.file("extdata", "sigugr.gpkg", package = "sigugr") p <-sf::st_read(source_gpkg, layer = 'lanjaron', quiet = TRUE)  source_tif <- system.file("extdata", "sat.tif", package = "sigugr") r <- terra::rast(source_tif)  result <- clip_raster(r, p)

what: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
title: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
text: Combines multiple raster files single virtual raster layer (VRT). accepts one folder names containing raster files creates virtual raster file. output file name provided, temporary file used.

title: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
code: compose_raster(dir, out_file = NULL)

title: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
text: dir string vector strings representing folder names containing raster files. out_file string specifying output file name (without extension). `NULL`, temporary file used.

title: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
text: `SpatRaster` object `terra` package.

title: Compose a Raster Layer from Multiple Files — compose_raster
code: input_dir <- system.file("extdata", "mdt", package = "sigugr")  r <- compose_raster(input_dir)

what: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
text: Copies first style definition source (either GeoPackage file PostGIS connection) assigns layers destination GeoPackage.

title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
code: copy_styles_layer(from, to)

title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
text: data origin. can : - string representing path GeoPackage file. - `DBI` database connection object PostGIS database, created using [RPostgres::dbConnect()]. string representing path destination GeoPackage file.

title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
text: updated `layer_styles` table, returned invisibly.

title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
text: function reads first style `layer_styles` table source GeoPackage PostGIS database. style applied layers destination GeoPackage.

title: Copy Layer Styles from Source to Destination — copy_styles_layer
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ source_gpkg <- "source.gpkg" dest_gpkg <- "destination.gpkg"  copy_styles_layer(from = source_gpkg, to = dest_gpkg) } # }

what: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
text: Copies first style definition source (either GeoPackage file PostGIS connection) specified layers PostGIS database.

title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
code: copy_styles_layer_names(from, to, layers, database, schema = "public")

title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
text: data origin. can : - string representing path GeoPackage file. - `DBI` database connection object PostGIS database, created using [RPostgres::dbConnect()]. database connection object destination PostGIS database (e.g., `RPostgres::dbConnect`). layers character vector layer names destination database style applied. database string specifying name PostGIS database. schema string specifying schema PostGIS database layers reside. Default `"public"`.

title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
text: updated style object (`obj`), returned invisibly.

title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
text: function reads first style `layer_styles` table source applies specified layers destination PostGIS database.

title: Copy Styles to Specific Layers in a PostGIS Database — copy_styles_layer_names
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ source_gpkg <- "source.gpkg" conn <- DBI::dbConnect(   RPostgres::Postgres(),   dbname = "mydb",   host = "localhost",   user = "user",   password = "password" )  layers_to_style <- c("layer1", "layer2")  copy_styles_layer_names(   from = source_gpkg,   to = conn,   layers = layers_to_style,   database = "mydb",   schema = "public" )  DBI::dbDisconnect(conn) } # }

what: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
title: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
text: function takes `sf` object `terra::SpatRaster` input returns new `sf` object representing bounding box (minimum bounding rectangle) input layer.

title: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
code: generate_bbox(layer)

title: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
text: layer `sf` object `terra::SpatRaster` object.

title: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
text: `sf` object representing bounding box input layer.

title: Generate a Bounding Box as an sf Object — generate_bbox
code: # Example with a vector layer source_gpkg <- system.file("extdata/sigugr.gpkg", package = "sigugr") lanjaron <- sf::st_read(source_gpkg, layer = "lanjaron", quiet = TRUE) bbox_vector <- generate_bbox(lanjaron)  # Example with a raster layer raster_file <- system.file("extdata/sat.tif", package = "sigugr") raster <- terra::rast(raster_file) bbox_raster <- generate_bbox(raster)

what: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
text: Extracts categories (IDs, descriptions, colors) first style definition stored GeoPackage PostGIS database. extracted categories filtered include present raster values.

title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
code: get_layer_categories(from, r_clc)

title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
text: data origin. can : - string representing path GeoPackage file. - `DBI` database connection object PostGIS database, created using [RPostgres::dbConnect()]. r_clc `terra` raster object containing raster values filter categories.

title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
text: data frame containing filtered categories following columns:   - `id`: category ID (integer).   - `description`: description category (character).   - `color`: color associated category hexadecimal format (character).

title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
text: function retrieves style definitions `layer_styles` table provided GeoPackage PostGIS database. filters categories include whose IDs match unique values present raster. function useful associating raster values corresponding descriptions colors, typically visualization analysis tasks.

title: Get Layer Categories Based on Raster Values — get_layer_categories
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gpkg_path <- system.file("extdata", "clc.gpkg", package = "clc") r_clc <- terra::rast("clc_raster.tif")  categories <- get_layer_categories(from = gpkg_path, r_clc = r_clc) } # }

what: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
title: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
text: Publishes band multi-band GeoTIFF raster file separate coverage specified workspace data store GeoServer instance.

title: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
code: gs_publish_bands(geoserver_url, user, password, workspace, data_store, raster)

title: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
text: geoserver_url character string specifying base URL GeoServer instance (e.g., "http://localhost:8080/geoserver"). user character string GeoServer username publish permissions. password character string GeoServer password corresponding specified user. workspace character string specifying target workspace raster bands published. data_store character string specifying base name data store GeoServer. Band names appended base name. raster character string specifying file path GeoTIFF raster file uploaded.

title: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
text: named list names correspond raster bands values   integers indicating status operation band:   - `0`: band published successfully.   - `1`: error occurred publishing process.

title: Publish Each Band of a Raster Separately to GeoServer — gs_publish_bands
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ geoserver_url <- "http://localhost:8080/geoserver" user <- "admin" password <- "geoserver" workspace <- "example_workspace" data_store <- "example_raster" raster <- "path/to/multiband_raster.tif"  gs_publish_bands(   geoserver_url = geoserver_url,   user = user,   password = password,   workspace = workspace,   data_store = data_store,   raster = raster ) } # }

what: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
title: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
text: Publishes vector layer GeoServer using REST API. Returns status code prints appropriate message indicating success failure.

title: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
code: gs_publish_layer(   geoserver_url,   user,   password,   workspace,   data_store,   layer_name,   title = NULL )

title: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
text: geoserver_url string, base URL GeoServer instance. user string, GeoServer username. password string, GeoServer password. workspace string, name GeoServer workspace. data_store string, name data store layer resides. layer_name string, name layer publish. title string, optional title layer. Defaults layer name provided.

title: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
text: integer indicating status operation:   - `0`: layer published successfully.   - `1`: error occurred publishing process.

title: Publish a layer to GeoServer — gs_publish_layer
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ gs_publish_layer(   geoserver_url = "http://my-geoserver.com/geoserver",   user = "admin",   password = "mypassword",   workspace = "my_workspace",   data_store = "my_datastore",   layer_name = "my_layer",   title = "My Layer Title" ) } # }

what: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
text: function publishes GeoTIFF raster file specified workspace data store GeoServer instance.

title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
code: gs_publish_raster(geoserver_url, user, password, workspace, data_store, raster)

title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
text: geoserver_url character string specifying base URL GeoServer instance (e.g., "http://localhost:8080/geoserver"). user character string GeoServer username publish permissions. password character string GeoServer password corresponding specified user. workspace character string specifying target workspace raster published. data_store character string specifying name target data store GeoServer. raster character string specifying file path GeoTIFF raster file uploaded.

title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
text: integer indicating status operation:   - `0`: raster published successfully.   - `1`: error occurred publishing process.

title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
text: function uses GeoServer REST API upload GeoTIFF raster file specified workspace data store. raster sent using HTTP `PUT` request GeoServer endpoint, response checked success. message printed indicate whether operation succeeded failed, error messages GeoServer displayed.

title: Publish a Raster to GeoServer — gs_publish_raster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Publish a raster to GeoServer geoserver_url <- "http://localhost:8080/geoserver" user <- "admin" password <- "geoserver" workspace <- "example_workspace" data_store <- "example_datastore" raster <- "path/to/raster.tif"  gs_publish_raster(   geoserver_url = geoserver_url,   user = user,   password = password,   workspace = workspace,   data_store = data_store,   raster = raster ) } # }

what: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
text: Writes band raster (`terra::SpatRaster`) specified schema PostGIS database. band written separate table database.

title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
code: pg_write_bands(sr, conn, schema = "public", prefix = NULL, postfix = NULL)

title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
text: sr `terra::SpatRaster` object containing raster bands write. conn database connection object PostGIS database (e.g., `RPostgres::dbConnect`). schema string specifying schema PostGIS database raster layers stored. Default `"public"`. prefix string prepend layer name. Default `NULL`. postfix string append layer name. Default `NULL`.

title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
text: Invisibly returns character vector names tables written PostGIS.

title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
text: Transforms table name according Snake Case convention.

title: Write Raster Bands to PostGIS — pg_write_bands
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ conn <- DBI::dbConnect(   RPostgres::Postgres(),   dbname = "mydb",   host = "localhost",   user = "user",   password = "password" )  sr <- terra::rast(nrows = 10, ncols = 10, nlyrs = 3, vals = runif(300))  tables <- pg_write_bands(sr, conn, schema = "geodata", prefix = "example_", postfix = "_raster")  DBI::dbDisconnect(conn) } # }

what: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
title: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
text: Transfers vector layers valid geometries GeoPackage file specified PostGIS database schema. Optionally allows setting custom geometry column name, adding prefixes postfixes table names, renaming layer fields follow Snake Case convention.

title: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
code: pg_write_layers(   gpkg,   conn,   schema = "public",   prefix = NULL,   postfix = NULL,   geom_colum = "geom",   snake_case_fields = TRUE )

title: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
text: gpkg string, path GeoPackage file. conn PostGIS database connection object created [RPostgres::dbConnect()]. schema string, schema PostGIS layers stored. Default `"public"`. prefix string, optional prefix add table names PostGIS. Default `NULL`. postfix string, optional postfix add table names PostGIS. Default `NULL`. geom_colum string, name geometry column set. Default `"geom"`. snake_case_fields logical, whether convert field names Snake Case. Default `TRUE`.

title: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
text: Invisibly returns character vector names tables written PostGIS.

title: Write GeoPackage Layers with Geometry to PostGIS — pg_write_layers
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ conn <- DBI::dbConnect(RPostgres::Postgres(), dbname = "mydb") gpkg_file <- "example.gpkg" pg_write_layers(   gpkg_file, conn, schema = "my_schema", prefix = "pre_", postfix = "_post" ) DBI::dbDisconnect(conn) } # }

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
text: Writes bands raster (`terra::SpatRaster`) specified schema PostGIS database. bands written table database.

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
code: pg_write_raster(sr, conn, schema = "public", table_name)

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
text: sr `terra::SpatRaster` object containing raster bands write. conn database connection object PostGIS database (e.g., `RPostgres::dbConnect`). schema string specifying schema PostGIS database raster layers stored. Default `"public"`. table_name string, table name.

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
text: Invisibly returns character vector names tables written PostGIS.

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
text: Transforms table name according Snake Case convention.

title: Write Raster to PostGIS — pg_write_raster
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ conn <- DBI::dbConnect(   RPostgres::Postgres(),   dbname = "mydb",   host = "localhost",   user = "user",   password = "password" )  sr <- terra::rast(nrows = 10, ncols = 10, nlyrs = 3, vals = runif(300))  tables <- pg_write_raster(sr, conn, schema = "geodata", table_name = "example_raster")  DBI::dbDisconnect(conn) } # }

title: sigugr 0.1.0
text: Initial functionality.
